p: The amphibians investigated belonged to 24 of the 74 amphibian families, representing only 2.7% of all described amphibian species ( table 1 and electronic supplementary material, table S6). Even the relatively well-known order of frogs and toads, the Anura, was represented by only 31% of its families ( table 1). The most species-rich amphibian family, the Hylidae, was represented by only 24 of 950 species. Other species-rich families, such as Dendrobatidae with 303 known species and Hyperoliidae with 223 known species, were not represented at all (electronic supplementary material, table S6).
